title: 103_hr2662
content: The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" establishes business activity targets for small businesses and modifies procurement procedures. The Small Business Act is amended to allow participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10%. The term "participating agency" excludes the Department of Defense. The Small Business Act amendment allows participating agencies, excluding the Department of Defense, to contract with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or a 10% price preference. This authority is effective until September 30, 2000. Eligibility of past development program participants for Section 8(a) contract awards. Section (8)(a)(1)(C) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow awards to small businesses owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period. Eligibility criteria for competitive and sole source awards are specified. The Small Business Act is amended to allow awards to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period. Eligibility criteria for competitive and sole source awards are specified. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act by eliminating competitive contracts and removing subparagraph (D). SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competitive bidding for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if certain conditions are met. The Small Business Act amendment requires competitive bidding for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency under specific conditions, including restrictions to award contracts to small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals upon request. The Small Business Act requires competitive bidding for contracts with restrictions to award contracts to small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals upon request. Small business concerns must subcontract 20-50% of the contract value to small businesses in the developmental stage of minority small business and capital. The Small Business Act mandates that a small business concern must subcontract 20-50% of the contract value to small businesses in the developmental stage of the minority small business and capital ownership development program. The head of a participating agency must ensure that follow-on contracts for the same products or services are awarded under the same authority. The Small Business Act requires small businesses to subcontract a percentage of the contract value to small businesses in the developmental stage. Follow-on contracts for the same products or services must be awarded under the same authority. SEC. 7. Study of development program participation terms by industry sector; suspension of development program graduations. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a short-term study on program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Results of the study will be transmitted to relevant committees within a year. Additionally, the suspension of development program graduations for small business concerns is addressed. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small businesses to continue participating in programs until final regulations are issued based on a study conducted on industry sectors. Small businesses can participate in programs until final regulations are issued based on a study of industry sectors. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT. Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) of the Small Business Act for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act. SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS. SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS. The Small Business Act is amended to establish uniform procedures for contesting the status of a concern as a 'small business concern owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals'.
